bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.R. Hufford, September 13, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests a photograph of the Dean Memorial Bridge and a copy of its memorial inscription.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.R. Hufford, September 13, 1940
div1.opener:
September 13, 1940
Dr. A. R. Hufford
26 Sheldon Ave. S. E.
Grand Rapids, Michigan
My dear Doctor Hufford:
div1.p:
I am reading a paper on the conquest of yellow fever at the
dedication of the Lazear Memorial Building, Washington and Jefferson College,
October 26.

William H. Dean, of Grand Rapids, was one of the early privates
who volunteered for these experiments, and there is a Dean Bridge in Grand Rapids
named for him. Miss Frances Wood, librarian there, kindly sent me a newspaper
clipping about him. I am anxious to get a photograph of the bridge and in particu-
lar to have an exact and true copy of what is on the memorial plate, which I under-
stand is somewhere on the bridge. The librarian thinks the Camera Shop may have
a photograph, and I am asking her to have them send me one if they have one.
Otherwise, I may write to you and ask you to do me the great favor of taking a
snapshot of the bridge for me and in the meantime, I wonder if you could drive
by the bridge sometime soon and copy the memorial tablet for me.
I would appreciate this very much indeed.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
